definition: day and night/round-the-clock
(negative prefix)/not/no
part/share/ingredient/component

to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)
daytime
night
variant of 夜[ye4]

sentences.english: I think about you day and night.
Good programmers think about their work 24/7.
sentences.chinese: 好的程序员不分昼夜在思考完善自己的项目。

sentences.english: In principle a volcano can erupt at any time, day and night.
sentences.chinese: 原则上说，火山随时都会爆发，不分昼夜。

sentences.english: They've been there around the clock for 10 consecutive days.
sentences.chinese: 他们已经连续10天不分昼夜地聚集在那里。

sentences.english: The green food all day and night canned trust to take.
sentences.chinese: 不分昼夜都可以放心摄取的绿色食品。

sentences.english: Who vows to fight like a man for what's right night and day?
sentences.chinese: 是谁宣誓为了正义不分昼夜的战斗？

sentences.english: Doctors and health workers are working around the clock to cope.
sentences.chinese: 医生和保健工作者正在不分昼夜地工作。

sentences.english: Mutta-matutta nursed him night and day, with the sourest monkey-physic.
sentences.chinese: 玛特玛不分昼夜地照顾他，给他服下最酸的猴药。

sentences.english: In the center of the hut a fire burned night and day from the beginning to the end of the year.
sentences.chinese: 在小茅屋的中间终年不分昼夜地燃烧着炉火。

sentences.english: I was young, single, and willing to work all hours of the day and night.
sentences.chinese: 我年纪轻，又是单身一人，我愿意不分昼夜的工作。

sentences.english: During the days in Shengzhen, Zhong Lijun went all out, working round the clock.
sentences.chinese: 在深圳的日子里钟丽君不分昼夜的奋力打拼。

definition: night and day (idiom); continuous strenuous effort
day and night/regardless of the time of day or night
without stopping to sleep or have a rest (idiom)
overnight until daybreak (idiom); all night long/day and night
day and night/around the clock
day and night/period of 24 hours/continuously, without stop
to make nothing of hardships
to spare no effort
to be sleepless all night
to stay up through the night (idiom)
the whole night
the whole night/all through the night
to neglect sleep and forget about food (idiom)/to skip one's sleep and meals/to be completely wrapped up in one's work
lit. to continuously revolve/to work non-stop/to work around the clock (idiom)
see 起早貪黑|起早贪黑[qi3 zao3 tan1 hei1]
to travel or work through night and day/to toil away for long hours
